tit.e: Wagashi no hi (the Day of Japanese Sweet)
Wagashi no hi (the Day of Japanese Confectionery)
tit.cmt: 菓子の訳語はsweetsより広義のconfectioneryにしました。
tit.e: Wagashi no hi (the Day of Japanese Confectionery)

sen.j: 和菓子の日（わがしのひ）は、全国和菓子協会が1979年（昭和54年）に制定した記念日。
sen.e: Wagashi no hi' (the Day of Japanese Sweet) was a memorial day established by 'Zenkoku Wagashi Kyokai' (Japan Wagashi Association) in 1979.
Wagashi no hi' (the Day of Japanese Confectionery) was a memorial day, established by 'Zenkoku Wagashi Kyokai' (Japan Wagashi Association) in 1979.
sen.cmt: 菓子の訳語はsweetsより広義のconfectioneryにしました。
sen.e: Wagashi no hi' (the Day of Japanese Confectionery) was a memorial day, established by 'Zenkoku Wagashi Kyokai' (Japan Wagashi Association) in 1979.
June 16 every year
It is observed every year on June 16.
sen.cmt: 表現調整、パンクチュエーション
sen.e: It is observed every year on June 16.

sen.j: 平安時代中期の承和 (日本)年間、国内に疫病が蔓延した。
sen.e: The plague prevailed across the nation during the age of Jowa, the middle of the Heian period.
Epidemics prevailed across the nation during the Jowa era in the middle of the Heian period.
sen.cmt: 疫病訳語：日本では明治時代までペスト流行が確認されていませんので、ペストと同義でもあるplagueではなく、広義のepidemicを使用しました。
sen.e: Epidemics prevailed across the nation during the Jowa era in the middle of the Heian period.

sen.j: 仁明天皇は年号を嘉祥と改めた。
sen.e: The Emperor Jinmei changed the era name to 'Kasho'.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Emperor Jinmei changed the era name to 'Kasho'.
Emperor Jinmei changed the era name to 'Kasho'.

sen.j: そして、その元年（848年）の6月16日に、16個の菓子や餅を神前に供えて、疾病よけと健康招福を祈ったとされる。
sen.e: It is said that on June 16, the first year of Kasho (848), the Emperor offered 16 sweets and rice cakes before the alter and prayed for plague prevention and good health.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: It is said that on June 16 in the first year of Kasho (848), 16 pieces of confectionery and rice cakes were prepared for a shrine offering and prayers were said for epidemic prevention and good health.
sen.cmt: 和暦は後項の話とのつながり上、意図的に残してあります。用語選択、スペル修正、表現修正（主語が天皇とは限らない為、受動態適用）
sen.e: It is said that on June 16 in the first year of Kasho (848), 16 pieces of confectionery and rice cakes were prepared for a shrine offering and prayers were said for epidemic prevention and good health.

sen.j: これが、6月16日に厄除け・招福を願って菓子を食う「嘉祥菓子」の習俗の起源となった
sen.e: This incident originated in 'Kashogashi' (Kasho sweet), the custome of eating sweet for plague prevention and good health on June 16.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: This is the origin of what is called the 'Kajo gashi' (Kajo cakes, where the term 'kajo' is an alternative reading for the era name Kasho) that is customarily eaten for epidemic prevention and good health on June 16.
sen.cmt: 用語選択、表現調整。 嘉祥（かじょう）菓子参考： [1] http://washokufood.blogspot.com/2010/05/kajoogui-ritual.html [2] http://www.wanogakkou.com/life/00200/00200_001_002_8.html
sen.e: This is the origin of what is called the 'Kajo gashi' (Kajo cakes, where the term 'kajo' is an alternative reading for the era name Kasho) that is customarily eaten for epidemic prevention and good health on June 16.

sen.j: そして、さまざまに形を変えながら、平安期から中世・近世まで存続した。
sen.e: This custom existed from the Heian period to the Middle ages and the Modern times, undergoing various changes.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: This custom continued to exist from the Heian period to medieval and premodern times, undergoing various changes.
sen.cmt: 用語選択、表現調整（特に、the Middle Agesは西洋中世を想起させる定型句である為避けました）
sen.e: This custom continued to exist from the Heian period to medieval and premodern times, undergoing various changes.

sen.j: 全国和菓子協会は、こうした故事にちなみ、日本の食文化を正しく隆盛に後世に伝え残すために一層の努力を積み重ねることを目的として、この記念日を制定した。
sen.e: Zenkoku Wagashi Kyokai' (Japan Wagashi Association) established the memorial day relating to this historical fact in order to make further effort to pass properly and successfully Japanese food culture on to next generations.

The Zenkoku Wagashi Kyokai (Japan Wagashi Association) established the memorial day relating to this historical fact in order to make greater efforts to pass on Japanese food culture properly and actively to the next generations.
